message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of scheduling a crawler to retrieve content from several sites with ephemeral content. This problem is related to information retrieval (cs.IR) as the reward is measured in the number of clicks or relevant search requests. The problem is also related to data structures (cs.DS) as the paper discusses the decomposition of the problem and the development of a crawling policy. The use of optimal control and Whittle index also suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the paper's focus on developing a crawling policy for timely retrieval of content suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
